DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date relating to a cancer follow-up pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a cancer follow-up pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
